Every time someone talks about poles in KSP, the discussion is bound to end up with anomalies.

How come Minmus is so neat? There is only one faint line on the northern pole.

(mind the shadow - the "line" is going towards my lander)

The only "anomaly" is the camera twisting around it. That's it. So if Minmus with its wild terrain can be so neat up there, why can't other planetary bodies be, too?
Minmus is a mystery. What it is made of? Why does its surface look so weird? Why there are no anomalies

I agree! Well, believe it or not but i visit minmus more than any body in KSP, I mean, it has a good--flat surface, icy, mountains, low gravity.. But no anomalies around? Buhhh! It could have been 10x better, searching for anomalies is why I use rovers!

Please SQUAD! Listen to us
Guys it does have an anomaly. Admitedly it is quite difficult to find and I would even say almos impossible for the naked Eye

I've been to the poles of Minmus myself and I've wondered why too, but I think it's smooth because the four sections that join at the pole are really similar, unlike on say, the mun, and there they need more space in order to join up, so they create a pyramid like structure in order to stop the GREAT HOLES IN THE TEXTURE from appearing

Because Minmus is a ball of mint and(with terrain scatter) choc chip ice cream orbiting Kerbin, kept at an optimal temperature with the heating by Kerbol and the cold of space reaching an equilibrium.

Peaks that are lumpy and creamy like gelato, plains of icy, minty popsicle-like sheets.

I can see why Jeb is thrilled at the prospect of being stranded performing a long duration scientific mission to Minmus's poles.

dude, Danny can kill a kerbal anywhere in the Kerbolar system

Minmus is pretty smooth, it has big mountains but they are all very smooth slopes up and down them no small bumps and craters. The extreme wrinkles on the Mun are from the small procedural craters and bumps being crushed up by the spherical mapping.
I'll have to investigate a pole on Eeloo. It is very similar to Minmus, without procedural craters. So far I know the poles of Kerbin, MÃƒÂ¼n, Eve, Duna and Ike are messed up.
